newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti - no meeting yet seen with banks.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti - no meeting yet seen with banks.

text.p: Francesco Cingano, chairman of deal-making Italian merchant bank Mediobanca, said that for now no meeting is planned between troubled high-tech group Olivetti and its creditor banks.
The secretive Milan institution which has links with most of the country's major companies itself holds some two percent of Olivetti's capital.
"No such meeting is planned for the moment," Cingano told reporters as he entered a meeting of the Italian Banking Association ABI.
Most of Olivetti's bank creditors have played down Italian press speculation about the amount of their exposure to the loss-making group.
